Key Match Events: Mohamed Ali Ben Romdhane created the first goal and scored the second
Ali Abdi headed the rebound from a Ben Romdhane free-kick past goalkeeper Sheikh Sibi on 11 minutes
Gambia levelled within three minutes as Ali Sowe swivelled in a crowded goalmouth and fired past Amanallah Memmiche
Ben Romdhane scored the winner on 75 minutes in the corner of the net
Post-Match Reflections: Tunisia have competed at each edition of the biennial Cup of Nations since 1994
Their greatest achievement came 10 years later when they hosted and won the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Victory for former champions Tunisia was predictable as they are 91 places above Gambia in the world rankings
They top the table with six points having edged Madagascar 1-0 three days ago
Officially a home fixture for Gambia, it was moved to Moroccan coastal city El Jadida, 96 kilometres (60 miles) south of Casablanca, as they do not have an international-standard stadium
